benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts - Retrieve an account by external key

covered: Valid Request: Multiple success paths validate retrieval by externalKey with default and optional params, returning 200 and application/json.

Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage for accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, missing required param, invalid enum/boolean, malformed/oversized externalKey, extra params ignored.
Empty Response: 404 covered via nonexistent externalKey and empty database.
Authorization: 401 scenarios covered for missing and invalid tokens.
Security/Validation hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected with 400; boundary tests for externalKey length.
Resilience/Errors: Integration/service failure paths (502/503/504) exercised beyond story to verify error handling.
Performance: Latency under normal and concurrent load validated.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No checks for ETag/Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since).
Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating throttling/429 responses under burst traffic.
Authorization breadth: No 403 Forbidden case for authenticated but unauthorized user/tenant or missing tenant headers.
Audit parameter completeness: No explicit test for audit=NONE (default is implied but not asserted when provided).
Response schema: No validation of Account JSON against #/definitions/Account (field presence/types).
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept headers or 406 handling; only one Content-Type check on success.
Method robustness: No 405 Method Not Allowed check for non-GET methods on this endpoint.
Idempotent header behavior and error body format: No assertions that error responses follow standard error schema and headers.
recommendations: Add caching scenarios: verify ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control on 200 responses; exercise conditional GET (If-None-Match) expecting 304 Not Modified.
Add rate limiting tests: sustained bursts leading to 429 with Retry-After header; ensure normal traffic remains unaffected.
Include 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users lacking permissions or tenant access; validate multi-tenant header requirements if applicable.
Add explicit audit=NONE test to confirm default and explicit NONE behave identically (no audit info returned).
Introduce JSON schema validation against the Account definition for both success and error payloads (standard error model).
Expand content negotiation tests: send Accept: application/json (happy path) and unsupported types to assert 406 (if applicable), and verify error Content-Type.
Add negative method test (e.g., POST/PUT/DELETE on this path) to assert 405 with Allow header.
Verify consistent error body fields (code, message, type) and presence of correlation/tracking headers if standard in the API.
